attributes.action: sanction the immediate release from prison of Ronnie Biggs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ronnie Biggs has been refused parole by Jack Straw, Minister for Justice.  The Parole Board concluded that he posed a 'manageable risk'.  He is tube fed and communicates by hand gestures and the use of an alphabet panel. He has had a series of strokes and a chest infection.

In the name of common humanity, please demand that Mr Straw sign the release order in order that Mr Biggs can end his days with his family and they with him. This is not a defence of his past actions.  It is a plea that an 80 year old man may die  at home.

This would be, on the part of the PM, an act, not of weakness but  of humanity and strength.

rejection.details: As stated in our terms and conditions, we cannot accept petitions on individual legal cases. Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
